instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 160mA
threads.message:
I managed to get the board to work by heating the CPU. Booted up and I had display.
Shut it down to reassemble and tested again but would not come on.
Board now stuck at 20v 
Draws 220mA for 5 seconds then drops to 160mA and stays at that.
Would an SMC reset fix this or am I looking at a problem with CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 160mA
threads.message: Bad CPU, classic issue of this board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 160mA
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 160mA
threads.message: Is it worth changing the cpu just to retrieve the data and can it be replaced with just a regular heat gun?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 160mA
threads.message:
You can try to heat entire board into IR oven.
If boots and get access to its SSD, recover the data as soon as possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 160mA
threads.message:
I canâ€™t find an IR Oven on eBay. Is this what you mean? Will this do?

[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/T-8280-Rework-Station-Infrared-IR-PCB-Preheater-Preheating-Oven-1600W-280x270mm-/273662030044?mkcid=16&mkevt=1&_trksid=p2349624.m46890.l49286&mkrid=710-127635-2958-0[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 160mA
threads.message:
No, that is just a preheater.

You can try to heat/reflow CPU as first time did.
Once booted (IF), retrive the data...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 160mA
threads.message: Have tried that a couple of times but no luck
